pageContext.claim: “Now, what has happened is, presidents over many years, from Ronald Reagan to Barack Obama, they came in, they said, "Okay, hey, do the best you can," and they left.  Nobody did anything about it.”
pageContext.analysis: NATO’s guideline, established in 2006, is that defense expenditures should amount to 2 percent of each country’s gross domestic product. In 2014, after Russia annexed Crimea, President Obama successfully urged NATO allies to change that guideline to a commitment.
